intro: Senecio gnaphalodes f. apricus, commonly known as the apricot senecio, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or sandy habitats. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes.
